title: Non-Divided Population
text: The population is not divided into different $$\frac{groups}{clusters}$$. Therefore, we know that this is not stratified or clustered sampling and will now focus on simple random, systematic, and convenience sampling.

title: Interviewing Classmates
text: We see that the student interviews classmates in his algebra class. We know that this is not a simple random sample because not all students have an equal chance of being selected: those in the student's algebra class have a much higher likelihood. Since the student doesn't have to perform much more work than just asking students in their class and is selecting students out of their proximity to them (in the same algebra class), is this a convenience sample?
